intro: Ouratea spinulosa, commonly known as the spiky ouratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
